meanings.definition: Avoiding making a decision or committing oneself.
meanings.sent1: She is known for her temporising nature when it comes to choosing a restaurant.
meanings.sent2: The temporising student kept changing his mind about which project to work on.
meanings.sent3: The temporising cat couldn't decide whether to go outside or stay in.
meanings.sent4: His temporising behavior was like a never-ending game of musical chairs.
meanings.sent5: The temporising clouds made it difficult to predict the weather.

meanings.definition: Acting in a way that delays or prolongs something.
meanings.sent1: The temporising tactics of the coach frustrated the players.
meanings.sent2: Her temporising actions only served to postpone the inevitable.
meanings.sent3: The temporising traffic made him late for the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The temporising river seemed to flow in slow motion.
meanings.sent5: The temporising repair work dragged on for weeks.
